section: Duties of Members may be amended, from time to time, by decision of the Members, provided that the Members' interests are not affected except with the unanimous consent of the Members.
explanation: This clause is ambiguous because it does not define what constitutes affecting a member's interest. It is unclear what decision requires unanimous consent, and what decisions require the consent of the other members. This ambiguity can lead to disputes among the members.

section:
Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"):

Member Contribution Description Agreed Value
BorrowMoney.com, inc To be determined USD
JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The agreed value for JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go contribution is listed as $3,500,000.00 USD, but it also states "$60,000.00 USD From Monthly Government , City And State, And Or Private Awarded Contracts. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions." This is a contradiction in text, what is the actual value of the contribution? It is misaligned in what the capital contribution is for each member. It is unclear whether the $60,000 and 10% are part of the $3,500,000 or in addition to it.

explanation: The agreed value for BorrowMoney.com, inc contribution is listed as "To be determined USD" This is an omission because the capital contribution for this member is not specified. Since the values are not determined it could lead to legal loopholes or consumer protection issues.

section:
Valuation of Interest

39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined in a manner deemed appropriate by the remaining members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be determined at the discretion of the remaining members.
explanation: This section presents a significant problem because it gives the remaining members complete discretion to determine the value of a withdrawing member's interest. This lacks objectivity and transparency, potentially leading to unfair valuations and disputes. There are no guidelines or criteria for determining the value, which creates an open door for the remaining members to undervalue the interest of the withdrawing member. It is also ambiguous and could lead to disputes among members.
